derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from French, from Latin caninus, from canis 'dog'

entry.def: Canine teeth or canines are pointed teeth near the front of the mouth of humans and of some animals.

means.word_mean: 1. one of the four pointed conical teeth (two in each jaw) located between the incisors and the premolars
2. any of various fissiped mammals with nonretractile claws and typically long muzzles
1. of or relating to a pointed conical tooth
2. of or relating to or characteristic of members of the family Canidae

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……的"; 2. 表名词,"状态,药物等"; 3. "物体"; 4. 表名词,"人或女人"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 海的,海生的;船舶的,航海的

stems_affixes.word_buile: prist=first首先,最初+ine……的→adj.太古的,纯洁的,新鲜的
route路线,路程+ine……的→adj.常规的,例行的
serpent蛇+ine……的→adj.似蛇般绕曲的,蜿蜒的
anti反+febr热+ine状态,药物等→n.[化]乙醯胺苯,退热冰
caffee咖啡+ine状态,药物等→caffeine→咖啡因
fam饿+ine状态,药物等→n.饥荒,饥馑
route路线,路程+ine状态,药物等→routine常走的路线→常规

stems_affixes.word_buile: vasel+ine状态,药物等→由商标名转化而来
con一起+cub躺+ine人或女人→一起躺着的人→情妇
figure形体,蒴像+ine人或女人→figurine小塑像
hero英雄+ine人或女人→n.女英雄;女主角
philist菲力斯人+ine人或女人→n.庸人,市侩
